poem:
**Diplomacy's Dance**

In quiet rooms where power sways,  
a whisper bends the corridor's ear.  
Constitutions stand, weathered stone,  
while leaders drift like leaves,  
brushed by autumn's hand. In murmur's  
wake, a curious bond burns,  
not explained but understood,  
strange as the heart's unfathomable pull,  
against a backdrop of unyielding earth.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Zelenskyy says territorial swaps not possible under Ukrainian constitution ahead of White House meeting – live 9.32pm BST Asked behind the scenes at June’s G7 summit if he could explain why Donald Trump seemed to like him so much, Keir Starmer admitted he did not really know. Whatever the reason, when it comes to Ukraine, the UK prime minister is once again hoping to exploit this somewhat curious relationship. As soon as it was announced". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
